title: Required Data
name: required
text: Please confirm which data you are contributing to the IMBIE altimetry experiment group.

elements.name: time-series-sheets
elements.label: 1a. Time-series of mass change, mass change uncertainty, and of observed area:

elements.name: time-series-upload
elements.label: 1b. Upload a single, concatenated, time-series data file, following the IMBIE standard file format. Please do not apply any temporal smoothing to your data, other than that required as part of your basic retrieval.

elements.name: mean-rate-sheets
elements.label: 2a. Rates of mass change and their uncertainties, and the observed areas and time intervals over which these are calculated. Remember these data will form the basis of our mass balance aggregation, and so you should supply estimates for each region over as many time intervals as your method allows with confidence (your time intervals may overlap).

elements.name: mean-rate-upload
elements.label: 2b. Upload a single, concatenated, rate of mass change data file, following the IMBIE standard file format. Please do not apply any temporal smoothing to your data, other than that required as part of your basic retrieval.

title: Supporting Information
name: supporting
text: Please answer the following questions relating to the data set you are submitting to the IMBIE altimetry experiment group.

elements.name: missions
elements.label: 3. Which mission(s) have you employed in your altimetry mass balance calculation?

elements.name: elevation-methods
elements.label: 4. Which general method(s) have you employed to compute elevation changes?

elements.name: unobserved-methods
elements.label: 5. Which general method(s) have you employed to estimate elevation changes in unobserved regions?

options.label: Scaling according to ratio of basin area to observed area

elements.name: independant-observations
elements.label: 6. Which independent observations have you used to evaluate the elevations rates you have determined from altimetry?

elements.name: gia-models
elements.label: 7. Which model(s) have you employed to account for glacial isostatic adjustment in your mass balance calculation?

elements.name: icesat-methods
elements.label: 8. Which general method(s) have you employed to account for ICESat inter-campaign bias?

options.label: Applied Gaussian-Centroid correction to data that did not include it
Correction based on a target outside the study area
Correction from the scientific literature (provide citation)

elements.name: mass-change-methods
elements.label: 9. Which general method(s) have you employed to compute ice sheet mass changes from ice sheet volume changes?

options.label: Firn model driven by climate or reanalysis data
Firn model driven by other data

elements.name: methods-and-errors
elements.label: 10. Upload a document describing your mass balance methods and errors in full. This must be either a peer reviewed journal article or a document suitable for review by the IMBIE executive committee. (If you wish to upload multiple files, please upload them as a single .zip file)

title: Additional Experiments
name: additional
text: The IMBIE altimetry experiment group may perform additional analyses to investigate methodological differences in more detail. These experiments are optional. If you wish to participate in the additional experiments, please confirm which data you are contributing.

elements.name: volume-change
elements.label: 12a. Time-series of volume change and of volume change uncertainty for regions above and below 1500m in elevation.

elements.name: volume-change-upload
elements.label: 12b. Upload a data file and a metadata file describing the data file contents and format. Please do not apply any temporal smoothing to your data, other than that required as part of your basic retrieval.

elements.name: firn-volume-change
elements.label: 13a. Time-series of firn volume change and of firn volume change uncertainty for regions above and below 1500m elevation

elements.name: firn-volume-change-upload
elements.label: 13b. Upload a data file and a metadata file describing the data file contents and format. Please do not apply any temporal smoothing to your data, other than that required as part of your basic retrieval.

title: Other Information
name: information
description: Any other comments about your submission

elements.name: comments
elements.label: 14. Is there anything else you would like to tell us about in relation to your submission to the IMBIE altimetry experiment group?
